definition: to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: Some mourners wrote inscriptions on the wooden barriers of the pools.
sentences.chinese: 有些悼念者还在水池旁的木框上写下话语。

sentences.english: This is the stage where a person mourns the past.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们悼念过去的一个阶段。

sentences.english: He is ordering flags at all government buildings to be flown at half-staff in honor of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 他已下令所有政府大楼降半旗悼念遇难者。

sentences.english: Come mix & mingle with Denver’s top IE6 mourners.
sentences.chinese: 来和丹佛的IE6悼念者们聚会下吧。

sentences.english: During the memorial sequence, my son figured out something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 放那个悼念的连续镜头时，我儿子觉出了有些不对头。

sentences.english: The few mourners looked at her teenage street clothes with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 为数不多的悼念者看她穿着十几岁的街边服装惊呆了。

sentences.english: Family members mourned the loss of their loved ones at the World Trade Center.
sentences.chinese: 家属在世贸中心悼念死难者。

sentences.english: A poem or song composed especially as a lament for a deceased person.
sentences.chinese: 挽歌，挽诗专门为悼念某一死者所写的诗或歌。

sentences.english: Women mourn and gaze up at the entrance of the damaged building.
sentences.chinese: 两位女士凝视着被大火焚毁大楼的入口处悼念亡者。

sentences.english: Uma pequena homenagem a uma grande banda.
sentences.chinese: 小悼念一个伟大的乐队。

sentences.english: Today I mourn the loss of a dear friend.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我悼念我去世的一位好朋友。

sentences.english: My family's sorrow is to be expressed in personal tributes to the matriarch of our family.
sentences.chinese: 我们的悲伤将以个人对家里的女家长的悼念来表达。

sentences.english: Clusters of lit candles flicker outside the presidential palace where mourners are still leaving flowers.
sentences.chinese: 总统府外烛光摇曳，悼念者还在那里摆放了鲜花。

sentences.english: In the United Kingdom after the death of Diana, Princess of Wales in 1997
sentences.chinese: 英国人悼念1997年皇妃戴安娜的去世。

sentences.english: Hundreds of mourners attended the funeral of the two boys.
sentences.chinese: 上千悼念者参加了那两个男孩的葬礼。

sentences.english: Makeshift memorials like this one have appeared as the city mourns its loss.
sentences.chinese: 城市在悼念亡者，像这样的街头悼念形式出现了。

definition: to grieve over sb's death/to lament sb's death/mourning
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
to offer condolences (for the deceased)/to condole
to observe a moment of silence in tribute
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
